com.xtructure.xevolution.evolution.impl
Class AbstractReproductionStrategy<D>

java.lang.Object
  com.xtructure.xevolution.evolution.impl.AbstractEvolutionObject
      com.xtructure.xevolution.evolution.impl.AbstractReproductionStrategy<D>
Type Parameters:
D - type of data used by Genomes
All Implemented Interfaces:
EvolutionObject, ReproductionStrategy<D>
Direct Known Subclasses:
AbstractNEATReproductionStrategy, ReproductionStrategyImpl
public abstract class AbstractReproductionStrategy<D>
extends AbstractEvolutionObject
implements ReproductionStrategy<D>

AbstractReproductionStrategy implements the ReproductionStrategy interface.

It orchestrates the creation of child genomes, selecting which genomes will reproduce probabilistically, weighted by their fitness, and via which of MutateOperator or CrossoverOperator as selected by this ReproductionStrategy's OperatorSelecters.

The ReproductionStrategy with attempt to create children until the requested count has been reached; if no operator with succeed with any genome, the method will loop. It's recommended to use at least one Operator that will always succeed, e.g., CopyMutateOperator or CopyCrossoverOperator.

Author:
Luis Guimbarda

generateChildren

public java.util.Set<Genome<D>> generateChildren(Population<D> population)
Description copied from interface: ReproductionStrategy
Creates a set of Genome children based on the given Population. Genomes are selected for reproduction via roulette selection, weighted by fitness.

If when attempting to produce a child no Operator succeeds, then a different reproduction attempt is made; all of the returned children are products of an Operator.

The number of children produced is enough to bring the population size to that specified by the the EvolutionFieldMap, after dead genomes have been removed.

Specified by:
generateChildren in interface ReproductionStrategy<D>
Parameters:
population - the pool of potential parent genomes
Returns:
the set of Genome children.
